## Data

speed of light in free space, \(c = 3.00\times 10^{8}\mathrm{m s}^{- 1}\) permeability of free space, \(\mu_{0} = 4\pi \times 10^{- 7}\mathrm{Hm}^{- 1}\) permittivity of free space, \(\epsilon_{0} = 8.85\times 10^{- 12}\mathrm{Fm}^{- 1}\) \((\frac{1}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}} = 8.99\times 10^{9}\mathrm{mF}^{- 1})\) elementary charge, \(e = 1.60\times 10^{- 19}\mathrm{C}\) the Planck constant, \(h = 6.63\times 10^{- 34}\mathrm{Js}\) unified atomic mass constant, \(u = 1.66\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of electron, \(m_{\mathrm{e}} = 9.11\times 10^{- 31}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of proton, \(m_{\mathrm{p}} = 1.67\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) molar gas constant, \(R = 8.31\mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Avogadro constant, \(N_{\mathrm{A}} = 6.02\times 10^{23}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Boltzmann constant, \(k = 1.38\times 10^{- 23}\mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\) gravitational constant, \(G = 6.67\times 10^{- 11}\mathrm{Nm}^{2}\mathrm{kg}^{- 2}\) acceleration of free fall, \(g = 9.81\mathrm{m s}^{- 2}\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 108, 559, 145]]<|/det|>
\[s = ut + \frac{1}{2} at^{2}\] \[\nu^{2} = u^{2} + 2as\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 163, 524, 180]]<|/det|>
\[W = \rho \Delta V\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 193, 537, 223]]<|/det|>
\[\phi = -\frac{Gm}{r}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 234, 522, 252]]<|/det|>
\[p = \rho gh\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 262, 571, 295]]<|/det|>
\[p = \frac{1}{3}\frac{Nm}{V} < c^2 >\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 304, 536, 321]]<|/det|>
\[a = -\omega^2 x\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 338, 608, 375]]<|/det|>
\[\nu = \nu_{0}\cos \omega t\] \[\nu = \pm \omega \sqrt{(\chi_{0}^{2} - \chi^{2})}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 384, 537, 418]]<|/det|>
\[V = \frac{Q}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}r}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 426, 625, 445]]<|/det|>
\[1 / C = 1 / C_{1} + 1 / C_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 459, 593, 477]]<|/det|>
\[C = C_{1} + C_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 490, 528, 514]]<|/det|>
\[W = \frac{1}{2} QV\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 526, 593, 545]]<|/det|>
\[R = R_{1} + R_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 560, 625, 579]]<|/det|>
\[1 / R = 1 / R_{1} + 1 / R_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 593, 561, 611]]<|/det|>
\[x = x_{0}\sin \omega t\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 628, 581, 647]]<|/det|>
\[x = x_{0}\exp (-\lambda t)\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 656, 536, 689]]<|/det|>
\[\lambda = \frac{0.693}{t_{\frac{1}{2}}}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 567, 92]]<|/det|>
The orbital period of the Earth about the Sun is \(T\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 103, 181, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 102, 846, 122]]<|/det|>
Use ideas about circular motion to show that the mass \(M\) of the Sun is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 131, 526, 161]]<|/det|>
\[M = \frac{4\pi^2R^3}{GT^2}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 172, 875, 207]]<|/det|>
where \(R\) is the radius of the Earth's orbit about the Sun and \(G\) is the gravitational constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 205, 374, 223]]<|/det|>
Explain your working.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 390, 875, 409]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 420, 181, 440]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 420, 707, 440]]<|/det|>
The orbital period \(T\) of the Earth about the Sun is \(3.16 \times 10^{7} \text{s}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 437, 599, 456]]<|/det|>
The radius of the Earth's orbit is given in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 452, 680, 471]]<|/det|>
Use the expression in (i) to determine the mass of the Sun.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[520, 635, 875, 654]]<|/det|>
<form>mass = .............................................. $kg$ [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 551, 875, 585]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 591, 576, 611]]<|/det|>

<mark>[1]

Cylinder B has a constant volume of \(1.6 \times 10^{3} \text{cm}^{3}\) and contains \(0.20 \text{mol}\) of gas. When tap T is opened, the pressure of the gas in both cylinders is \(3.9 \times 10^{5} \text{Pa}\). No thermal energy enters or leaves the gas.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 127, 549, 145]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 196, 875, 229]]<|/det|>
A charged particle is accelerated from rest in a vacuum through a potential difference \(V.\) Show that the final speed \(v\) of the particle is given by the expression

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 234, 529, 280]]<|/det|>
\[\nu = \sqrt{\frac{2Vq}{m}}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 281, 836, 310]]<|/det|>
where \(\frac{q}{m}\) is the ratio of the charge to the mass (the specific charge) of the particle.
